{
    "number": 244961,
    "data": "1,6,84,4680,1118480,1108378656,4467856773184,72624976668147840,4740885567116192841984,1240362622532514091484054016,1299343104384081987198247370753024,5447177625434934817180194985991294945280",
    "name": "Decimal equivalent of the binary string generated by the n X n antidiagonal matrix read by rows.",
    "comment": [
        "The binary representation of a(n), padded with zeros on the left to make an n^2-bit binary number, where the digits are grouped into n rows of n digits, form an n X n binary matrix whose entries along the antidiagonal are 1's and 0's everywhere else. a(n) will be the smallest integer whose binary representation forms an n X n involutory matrix. (I.e., let M be the n X n matrix formed by this binary representation of a(n); then a(n) is the smallest integer such that M^2 = I_n (the n X n unit matrix).)"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Nathan J. Russell, <a href=\"/A244961/b244961.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..30</a>"
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} 2^((n-1)k).",
        "a(1) = 1, a(n) = (2^(n^2)-2^n)/(2^n-2) when n>1."
    ],
    "example": [
        "n=1 -> a(1) = 1 -> M = {{1}} -> M^2 = I_1 = 1.",
        "n=2 -> a(2) = 6 = 0110_2 ->  M ={{0, 1}, {1, 0}} -> M^2 = I_2.",
        "n=3 -> a(3) = 84 = 001010100_2 ->  M ={{0, 0, 1}, {0, 1, 0}, {1, 0, 0}}."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "For[b = 2, b <= 10, ++b, Print[(2^b^2 - 2^b)/(2^b - 2)];]"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) a(n) = if (n==1, 1, (2^(n^2)-2^n)/(2^n-2)); \\\\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 11 2014",
        "(MAGMA) [1] cat[(2^(n^2)-2^n)/(2^n-2): n in [2..15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 26 2014"
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,base",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Nathan J. Russell_, Jul 08 2014",
    "ext": [
        "Edited by _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 25 2014"
    ],
    "references": 1,
    "revision": 33,
    "time": "2016-12-01T02:51:23-05:00",
    "created": "2014-07-25T18:57:55-04:00"
}
